JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Student for Kinetic Data Analysis and Thermodynamic Modelling
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
DTU Chemical Engineering is looking for a competent student for Kinetic data analysis and Thermodynamic Modelling.

Chemical Engineering - AT-CERE
AT-CERE develops the energy resources of the future. Through both a theoretical and experimental approach, CERE is mapping subjects such as CO2 capture, transport, and storage, biogas, power-2-X technologies, and optimization of existing energy supplies.

We offer
A paid part-time job with the opportunity to carry out data analysis and thermodynamic modelling based on experiments previously carried out, expand your knowledge, understanding, and interpretation of experimental data, and get your name on a scientific publication. We have an informal work environment with colleges who are always ready to help.

The workload is approx. 10-15 hours a week and the position is starting at the beginning of June and ends at the end of October. The tasks that you will perform are the following:
  • Summarise and organize all the kinetic mesearuments done so far
  • Homogenous analysis of the kinetic data
  • Parameter fitting of Thermodynamic data with a thermodynamic model (Extended UNIQUAC)
  • Validation of the model with the new parameters

There will be a training period on all tasks and you can always ask for help.

Criteria
We are interested in students who are currently studying Chemical Engineering along with knowledge in the following areas:
  • Unit operations
  • Thermodynamics
  • Mass Transfer and reaction kinetics
  • Experimental knowledge in the above-mentioned areas is a bonus.

We are seeking a person who is responsible and can take initiative when things are not going as planned.

Salary and terms of employment
The appointment will be based on the collective agreement for student lecturers at universities etc. (SUL). Be expected to start in the first week of June.

Application and contact
Please submit your online application no later than 23 May 2022 (Danish time). Open the 'Apply online' link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, a half page of text shortly describing the courses you have taken, with any projects relevant to kinetic mesearuments, and thermodynamics along with your grades, and your CV.

If you want more information about the position, you can contact PhD student Sai Hema Bhavya Vinjarapu at 91621557 or e-mail shbvin@kt.dtu.dk.

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 13,400 students and 5,800 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.
